column2: . the legendary creatures known among the Northmen and the Rohirrim.

column1: The legend originated perhaps from the time when their ancestors
column2: the Éothéod saw and knew the Hobbits from the Vales of Anduin
column3: before or around their Wandering Days. From Holbytla the word Hobbits in Westron was derived.

column1: There is only one tale about them
column2: namely that they do not appear in any other tales. They do little
column3: and avoid the sight of men
column4: being able to vanish in a twinkling; and they can change their voices to resemble the piping of birds.

column1: When Théoden met Peregrin Took and Meriadoc Brandybuck standing guard at Isengard on 5 March
column3: he immediately connected them to the folklore creature although he noted that they werent known to Smoking from their mouths. He was corrected by Peregrin
column4: who said that they preferred the term "Hobbits" (kuduk).

column1: Holbytla is the Old English translation of Rohan language Kûd-dûkan "hole-dweller"
column2: from which itself the word Kuduk was derived.

column1: Holbytla seems to be a retroactive etymology
column3: which of course was initially a spontaneous inspiration by Tolkien without an explanation behind it.Humphrey Carpenter
